p: Pediatric hand, foot, and mouth disease (HFMD) is a common childhood affliction in Asian countries. 1 The disease is caused by a group of enteroviruses that become more active in warmer weather, and HFMD outbreaks occur seasonally in tandem with changes in ambient temperature. 2 A study in Environmental Health Perspectives projects that the incidence of HFMD in mainland China will increase overall in the coming decades as a consequence of global climate change. 3 However, in certain regions of the country, incidence may actually decrease.
